    	View the Class ScheduleSpecial Session SchedulesChico Distance & Online CoursesSummer Sessions (self-support)Winter Session (self-support)Fall 2023 Registration DatesContinuing students:April 24–May 19, 2023New students:Summer Orientation, June 13–July 27, 2023New student priority registration, July 31-August 2, 2023Registration Add/Drop Period:August 7–September 1, 2023Spring 2024 Registration DatesContinuing students:October 23–November 17, 2023New students:Spring OrientationJanuary 3-6, 2024New student priority registration,December 4-8, 2023Registration Add/Drop Period:January 8–February 2, 2024Registration HelpLog into the Portal and visit the Student Center for real-time class schedule information and to register, add, or drop classes.After the Add/Drop Period, you must use the Class Add and Drop Request Process to make any class changes.For more information on registering, review this step-by-step guide, or check out the Registration Help page.Other Dates & DeadlinesOther dates and deadlines. Event in first column followed by fall and spring dates.EventFall 2023 DateSpring 2024 DateRegistration & Tuition Fee Payment DeadlinePayment Deadline DetailsFirst Financial Aid RefundAugust 17, 2023January 18, 2024Last Day to Drop Classes for Full RefundAugust 20, 2023January 21, 2024First Day of ClassesAugust 21, 2023January 22, 2024University CensusSeptember 18, 2023February 16, 2024Add/Drop PeriodAdd/Drop ProcessFind additional dates on the Academic Calendar.Other ResourcesAccessibility Resource CenterAssociated StudentsCivic EngagementClassroom Technology ServicesHealth & Safety at Chico StateHonors ProgramIT Support ServicesStudent Consumer InformationStudent Learning CenterTesting OfficeUniversity Policies(opens in new window)WellCat Prevention

We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
